This is an example of using a perceptron to seperate a dataset with a hyperplane. The left side shows the 3D view of the data, where the bias variable has been added to each data point. The arrow represents the vector of weights learned by a pocket algorithm. Its normal can be seen slicing the data. I still have to finish drawing the intersection of the W-plane and the z=1 plane. I'm having trouble getting the vectors from THREEjs and the linear algebra library to play nice. The code can be found HERE The 3D stuff is done with the ThreeJS library, and the math is handled by Mathjs.
